snippet: After a battle with the British, the Metropolitan Museum of Art has successfully purchased an important 17th-century portrait by the French artist Charles Le Brun.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; three-month export ban is lifted on painting by Charles Le Brun that was purchased by Metropolitan Museum of Art, allowing it to travel to New York; Broadway Malls will host its first group art show, called Broadway Morey Boogie, in September; Art Intelligence, company founded by art historian Bridget Goodbody, is introducing series of educational apps for iPads.
lead_paragraph: After a battle with the British, the Metropolitan Museum of Art has successfully purchased an important 17th-century portrait by the French artist Charles Le Brun.

headline.main: British Cede Le Brun Portrait to the Met
headline.print_headline: British Cede Portrait to the Met
